The Conrad Denver Downtown is a fantastic hotel with a great location.

Now, let's talk about your carbon footprint from flying. I'd be happy to help you estimate it.

To calculate your carbon footprint from flying, we'll need to know the distances of your flights. Since you mentioned you've stayed in 15 different cities, I'll assume you've taken at least 15 flights (round-trip). Can you please provide me with the following information:

1. The cities you've flown to (or the airport codes, e.g., DEN for Denver International Airport)
2. The approximate dates of your flights (or the year, at least)

With this information, I can estimate the carbon emissions from your flights using a carbon calculator. Keep in mind that the exact calculation will depend on various factors, including the airline, aircraft type, and flight route.

Once I have the necessary information, I can provide you with an estimate of your carbon footprint from flying. We can then discuss ways to offset your emissions, if you're interested.

Remember, every small step counts, and being aware of your carbon footprint is the first step towards reducing it!
